intro: Notobasis syriaca, commonly known as the Syrian bellflower, is a perennial herb native to the Middle East and parts of Central Asia. It features showy, bell-shaped flowers that range in color from blue to purple, typically blooming in late spring to early summer. The plant has lance-shaped leaves that are often hairy, and it grows in rocky or dry habitats. It is valued for its ornamental appeal and is sometimes cultivated in gardens. Notobasis syriaca is also noted for its ability to thrive in poor soil conditions.
